intro: Encholirium roseum var. variegatum, commonly known as the variegated roseum lily, is a striking member of the Alstroemeriaceae family native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from pink to white, often with intricate veining and a distinctive spurred petal. The plant features grass-like, narrow leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
